glsa.title: MySQL: Two Denial of Service vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Two Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been discovered in MySQL.

background.p: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server.

description.p: mu-b discovered a NULL pointer dereference in item_cmpfunc.cc when processing certain types of SQL requests. Sec Consult also discovered another NULL pointer dereference when sorting certain types of queries on the database metadata.

impact.p: In both cases, a remote attacker could send a specially crafted SQL request to the server, possibly resulting in a server crash. Note that the attacker needs the ability to execute SELECT queries.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
